item.title: Projects
item.description: As a hobby, I develop videogames, and I’ve released two so far: Tengam Reproduction Man I am inordinately fond of both the Kotlin programming language and command-line utilities. I’ve created a few Kotlin-based utilities that I use pretty much every day: kinstall - a utility to manage gradle-project-based command-line utilities. tnote - a command-line note taking app. glasnik - a command-line REST client (like Postman but with no GUI). I spend more time than is advisable playing a videogame called Noita.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a software engineer and architect with a focus in the last 7 years on data engineering. I’ve worked in a variety of industries, including transportation, energy, videoconferencing, occupational health and human resources. I’ve also done work in the criminal justice non-profit space. You can download my resum√© here. I studied Philosophy in college, which has served me surprisingly well in software design and engineering. My philosophical interests center around cognition, language, complexity, Pragmatism, and the nature of mental concepts – all of which relate directly to the central problem of complexity in software devolpment.
You can reach me: by e-mail at dkilmer@gmail.com on LinkedIn on Twitter
